name: 4-pyridinealdoxime
Reason: The base unit for 4-pyridinealdoxime is pyridine, which has a melting point of 115.5°C. The oxime group (C=NOH) tends to increase the melting point due to additional hydrogen bonding capability (+20°C). However, the conjugation effect of the -CH=NOH group potentially reduces the melting point slightly (-4°C) due to stabilizing the planar structure and delocalizing electrons which might make the crystal lattice less rigid. Hence, the predicted shift would be an increase of roughly 16°C from the base pyridine melting point.
